comment: The online textbook chapters are very long, so lots of reading. The majority of your grade relies on your attendance, not on the actual knowledge you have. She goes on unrelated tangents about her personal life and acts as if she is a stand-up comedian doing her own show. Class is extremely unorganized and assignments dont make sense.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Professor Williams was a great psychology teacher. She told lots of stories that went with the lessons which made class bearable. She gave lots of extra credit assignments that were interesting to do. She lets you know at the beginning of the semester how you will be graded which is nice to be able to keep up with. Very funny and nice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Hands down a favorite class. Course content was very interesting and it was fun to be in class. Textbook heavy, be prepared to teach yourself. She goes over the book in class after chapter is due. Class can be personal but you do not need to participate in conversation. Williams is very passionate about psych and makes class fun.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: She was very caring and understanding. She gives a lot of extra credit so theres no reason you shouldnt passed. She may get off topic sometimes but its always relate to the topic.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Caring

comment: class is very hard and attendance counts for your grade. she is very unorganized and often forgets to tell you about assignments and how to do them. You have weekly hw assignments on top of group projects and long assignments.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Miss Williams does get off topic and honestly class shouldn't be mandatory because she mostly just goes over the summaries of each chapter. Attendance is graded. If you read and do the assignments you should do fine. There is a lot of extra credit provided. Only 2 tests (midterm and final), everything else (quizzes, assignments, etc.) is online.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Williams is an alright professor. The class is fairly simple, but the chapters can be a lot! Be ready to read! Participation is annoying especially in the morning. Class can be a little personal.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I honestly don't know why this lady is still a professor, and I don't think she does either. When she wasn't busy going off on unrelated tangents or bumbling through content of a book she clearly hasn't read, Miss Williams would frequently tell us how little she enjoyed teaching, had no plans to retire from this job, etc. Easy A, horrible lecturer.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Attendance is part of your grade. Lots of projects that involve your personal life. She is also sarcastic and loves to joke. I personally think she is a great professor, as long as you aren't tooo sensitive. Very enjoyable class, just make sure you show up for grade points and keep up with chapter reading/notes! And there are extra credits!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I had a lot of fun in this class. Sometimes even the assignments were fun. The only issue I had with this class was that at times she was a bit unorganized, but overall a solid professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is absolutely horrible. I do not know how she is a Professor at KSU. Everyone else who commented about her is spot on. Don't take her course.

Williams really can be bass ackwards sometimes, if you catch my drift. She's funny, but she is not accommodating. Her test questions are pretty sucky, and they don't seem to rely on the info learned in her textbook. Speaking of the textbook, it is one she wrote herself, and yet she doesn't seem to know the content in it! Honestly really bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She ALWAYS talked about how students didnt like her and would grade her badly here. 1 quiz each week, 10 questions in 10 min. The questions on the quizzes were somewhat like what was in the text but the midterm and final were not at all. Most people got C's on the two before she rounded it. Wasnt too helpful for info. NOT ACCOMODATING TO SDS.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: I have taken her for PSYC3305 as well in the past but this class was horrible altogether. Her lectures are mostly her babbling about her personal life. She uses Cengage so get ready to pay extra for your course materials. I do not recommend taking her at all especially with how the situation is with remote learning.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Horrible class- awful tests, morbid projects (writing your own funeral program/obituary and planning your death) unfair grading within multiple group projects, switches up the format of her tests so the final is extremely unlike the midterm, horrible at answering emails, lectures go on about unimportant information about her personal life.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Do not take her class. The exams are awful and she is extremely rude and disrespectful to her students. She will call you out without a second thought and doesn't care to embarrass you in front of the whole class. Extremely unprofessional and just adds to how miserable you will be in her class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She's a cool person but her quizzes are difficult for no reason. She wrote the textbook (expensive) and pulls the smallest details from it. Gives a LOT of work that is unnecessary. Gives a lot of extra credit, though. If you are doing bad in class, you can meet with her and she will do her best to help. She takes a long time to email back.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Williams is a good professor. She gives test before she teaches and most of her lectures are about her life. The quizzes and tests are over small things in the book, which is mandatory and you will not pass unless you purchase the book. If you have time to study a lot for this class take it. Class was mandatory at the beginning.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: omg please avoid her. her lectures are so shallow and tests have a lot of content. she gets distracted easily and sees class as more of a social time than a learning time. she can be rude to students and her TAs were rude at time and did not help students. i had to WORK for my A. i was miserable in her class save yourself and take someone else <3
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Worst prof Ive ever had. The material is pretty easy, but the tests are so poorly written it doesnt matter how much you study, it will still be difficult to do well. You mostly have to guess on the tests bc her questions are so bad its hard to know what they are asking. Her lectures are a joke. She is disorganized & does everything last minute

so bad. save yourself. here's why: -terrible lecturer. goes off topic a lot and lectures themselves are disorganized -quizzes are over minute details in textbook (and she wrote the book herself) -i am an A student and i barely scraped by -generally rude and confrontational -tests are way too hard/don't match up with her teaching don't take her!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: She seems like she would be a good teacher but she literally only gave 3 lectures throughout the entire semester. I had her hybrid class and she PILED on the homework. She acknowledged the ridiculous homework load, sympathized, and then never changed anything. Attendence is not required but she'll roast you infront of the class next time you showup
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: I don't like that the class requires sharing so much personal information, but she wants her students to succeed. And yes, lectures veer off into her personal business, but it's a psychology class. Psychology is personal. Lots of busy work, so don't take her if you can't complete really simple but lengthy, detailed assignments on time. Go to class.

Not the worst professor i've ever had, but definitely there at the bottom. Gets off topic quite often, her tests have questions with stupidly specific outdated information, assignments can get quite personal, and her online assignments have no real direction and leave the student clueless. That said, at least she's a nice person I guess?
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: She is not a terrible person, just a terrible professor. Does not teach at all, and expects students to know everything just by reading the text. Her grading of hybrid assignments is ridiculous because she expects us to do exactly what she wants, but does not specify on the grading syllabus. She is extremely rude and inappropriate to students.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Mrs. Williams really isn't that bad. Her lectures are hilarious and she keeps the topics interesting. I took hybrid so we had a quiz on the chapter every monday(just make sure you read) and then an assignment due every sunday. Some quizzes and assignments took more than others, but in general everything she gives you is doable. If you do the work
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Hilarious

comment: honestly not a terrible professor, she can get off topic a lot but she always posts the powerpoints and curves the midterm/final. would not recommend taking the class as a hybrid because the assignments can be a lot. online quiz due every week.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: This whole class is just busy work
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Teaches outdated, debunked information. Barely lectures, just sort of talks about her life/asks questions incredibly personal questions about theirs. Ignores disability accommodations. Assigns random, poorly explained homework projects. Oh, and almost all of the homework and essays and such require you to give deeply personal information. Yikes.

Totally awful. She gives quizzes on material before she is supposed to teach it, and when the lecture comes around, she doesnt teach anything. She scrolled through the book and asked US what was important, and told us to come up with our own assignments. Worst class Ive taken so far.

I thought the other reviews were exaggerations, but in just 2 weeks Stacey has solidified her place as one of the worst instructors I have ever had. The complete disregard for her own syllabus, last minute assignments on your family history, & feigned ignorance of how expensive her e-book is (HA) are just a few reasons I would NEVER recommend her.
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: I love Stacey. However, a lot of people probably won't. She's very straightforward and she has quizzes every week. You read a chapter a week. I took her hybrid. You have to attend class. Don't be late. She's not hard, she is just doing what she can to make sure you are actually learning. If you're lazy, or easily offended, don't take this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! It's only the fourth week in, and I am already regretting choosing her class. Stacy does not teach information, You must read if you want to learn about careers in Psychology. She will go off topic about a ridiculous story from her past. this professor only has a bachelors degree, and it shows in her teaching proficiency.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Williams cares for her students and is extremely energetic in class, but she will make you work for your grade. She has quizzes almost every class, lots of textbook reading, and many other homework assignments. If you're a Psychology major, she'll prepare you extremely well for the future. If not, you may want another professor.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious--TEST HEAVY

comment: Shes a very kind and nice person. She talks a lot about her family to relate the subject with her real life (some people liked it and others didnt). She does give you a lot of quizzes. The bottom line is that if you are a psychology major, shell be a great professor but if youre not, I would recommend another teacher.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She is really funny and knowledgable in the material, however she tends to cross a lot of lines. Don't take her class if you're offended easily. She tries to come off as teasing, but blatantly insults a lot of students. She assumes everyone is cheating and spends 20+ mins every class telling each student where to sit. The class is an easy A though.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: I took herfor a 8-week summer semester and yes you have multiple quizzes every class and yes you have an assignment due every week but its to help offset quiz grades so dont whine about it! There are 2 reflection papers that are opinion based, 2 pages doublespaced. 3rd Reflection is 4 pages but with a partner and its about your museum visit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Williams quizzes students every class on textbook, makes you buy TopHat to track your attendance, accuses students of cheating, 20 community service hours for a grade, numerous busy work assignments, no study guides for midterm or final, late at providing feedback and grades
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: She is AMAZING and Super funny. Yes there generally are lots of quizzes but this is to ensure you can get a good grade. There are also 3 easy things you can do that replace your 3 lowest quiz grades. Plus if you get perfect attendance she adds 3 points onto your final grade. She makes me wish I was a psych major so I could take her again
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Caring

comment: I am not the type of person to rate professors on this thing but I will go out of my way to rate this one. Lets just say I am a straight A student and struggled to make an 85 in the class. Terrible lectures, unclear grading, switches syllabus too much, quizzes daily. Coming from someone who puts a lot of effort in... don't take her ever.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: If you know you can't stick to online work, avoid her. The quizzes and readings (both online) will make or break you and there is usually 2 each week. Class time is her reviewing what you read. If you skip class YOU WILL FAIL (-3 pt. ea. absence). You do a group project, so if you hate people... ya. On a lighter note shes super funny and understand
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Extremely unorganized & not competent to teach- class was complete chaos the entire semester. Students don't want to hear about personal/family issues from a professor in class. Prepare to memorize the whole book, as tests are copy+pasted from the text. Does not follow syllabus schedule so throw that right in the trash. Absolute nightmare! AVOID!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: 3 points taken off for every class missed from your final grade. Two quizzes due every week that took about an hour each if you were okay with making a B on them. Class was pointless, she joked around the whole time which was fun but not helpful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: If you get perfect attendance you get 3 points to your overall grade, BUT every class you miss she takes off 2points of your FINAL GRADE. There was a quiz over a chapter every class meeting along with an intense portfolio. There is only exams2 exams (25% EACH,100 questions). Most volunteer 20 hrs and complete 100 pg powerpoint about your life.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Tests are tough

comment: this professor gives a lot of homework and doesn't really know how to help her students accomplish it. everyday theres a quizz on the reading assigned. the class is just a powerpoint pressentation of what you read for homework, it's review not really teaching. she talks a lot off topic and about everyones lives. its a los of work
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Her class is pretty easy but she is a mess. She does not teach at all just rants, which some people found funny but it was too much at times. You have a quiz every class, which is always straight from the chapter assigned. Tests are usually comprised of quizzes. Nothing cumulative. Lose 2 points every class you miss but gain 3 if you come everyday.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She's entertaining, just wish I didn't take the class with her. Quiz beginning every class on the chapter read the night before, then lectures after we've already taken the quiz. Not a lecture though, just open discussion. I've never had to teach myself before so thats why I struggled. Do not take if you don't want to dedicate lots of time
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: WARNING TO ALL!!! AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS! Worst professor I have ever had, she doesn't teach, assigns a lot of readings and questions that have nothing to do with what you read, it's pretty apparent she has no idea what she is doing. Talks about her children more than any class material, and is not helpful at all. STAY AWAY!
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: She is the most disrespectful professor I have ever met. Someone said they wanted to be an alcohol/drug addict counselor because they want to make a difference and she said they would make more of a difference running some fundraiser. quiz everyday. AVOID THIS PROFESSOR. No respect for her students. Lashes out on students.

If you think you're going to miss even one or two classes, don't take her. She keeps a mental note of who misses or skips and is really hard on you if you do, even if you were sick or had an emergency. There are quizzes everyday.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Shes so mono toned you can barely listen to her without falling asleep. She requires attendance and takes it serious. Her PowerPoints are literally right from the book but you have to do your own notes at home because she flies through the PowerPoint in class. Do not take her, unless you have to
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I love the class and she is a cool teacher . She makes learning fun.  Her teaching style is unique.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Her class is very entertaining; however, she doesn't seem to teach as much. A lot of the time you teach yourself and there is a quiz every single day that you have to be prepared for. GO TO CLASS because she takes 2 points off of your final grade every day you miss. She does jeopardy 2x to get someone out of the midterm and final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Honestly, she can be funny at times. However, this doesn't excuse the fact she does not teach. She'll give you a quiz every period then afterward will teach what you just took a quiz on. She's very bad at emailing back and will disuse something you bought for her class. She'll accuse everyone of cheating. If I were you, I'd honestly avoid her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Take this class if you can! She is one of my favorite professors. The students who complain in the comments did not give the class nor Mrs. Williams a chance. This class is not hard, you just need to get ready to read. Try not to skip too many classes and you will be fine. She will work with you and your grade if you pay attention in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: Your grade is based off quizzes (very beginning of class, every monday), attendance (gives 10 points for perfect attendance, subtracts 2 from final grade for every absence), and a semestre long paired project (in which you're paired with someone she thinks is your complete opposite based on certain criteria, partner decides your grade). :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This prof requires commitment in all her classes makes you an independent learner She doesnt teach the class students teach the class through presentations Quiz every class before presentations quiz is not from her its from the author of the book you have a research ppr midterm final and presentation grade Takes off 2 pts per day attendance .
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Terrible. Had zero lectures in  class, instead about her kids and husband. Students teach her class for her through mandatory group projects. Quizzed daily beforehand on material never taught. Knows everything about her students by bringing three balloons and singling out students in class.  She wants a ten page paper... how about we see her paper.
Professor Williams pushes you to do your best. She is also hilarious and has the class laughing all the time. This class requires commitment, but it's worth it. I have learned a lot.

Easy to pass this class, but I would not recommend taking any classes with her if you want to learn. She expected us to read the chapter and go over the lecture on our own then take a quiz. She would not teach the lecture afterwards just talk with the class about random stuff then go over the quiz. And NO help with the research assignment. Beware!

One of my favorite classes. There is a quiz every class period so you have to read if you want to pass (each chapter is about 40 pages). You have to read the textbook to know material because the quiz is before she teaches. Very funny professor and really knows what she is talking about. Took 3 points off final grade for every absence.

Although there is an expectation to read a chapter of the text book before each class for an impending quiz that will occur daily, the book is easy to grasp and not too difficult to the point where the class is difficult. She is a funny person who does expect a lot out of you, but will make it so that you can easily pass the class.

You absolutely need to read the book. There are quizzes every class on the chapters. Luckily the book was a good read. The lectures are fun/interesting. Lit class discussions. There is a mid term and final along with one research project and paper. Definitely one of my favorite professors. If you have perfect attendance you get extra credit

Professor Williams is a very funny woman, but to be honest, teaching just isn't the profession for her. Expect a quiz every time you walk in the door, and for Abnormal or any upper level class, a lengthy research paper. She isn't a tough grader, but if you're unclear about a grade you received, she will be of no help. Take someone else if possible.

I LOVE Professor Williams! She has actually inspired me to pursue Psychology as my major. She makes psychology fun and hilarious as well! She loves to tell stories and they're very interesting and related to the lectures. However, quizzes can be quite tough, but she drops like 6 of them. A midterm, final, and one group project. Just read + study!

Helpfulness: She definitely has a handle on all of the course concepts , so if you need elaboration on something just ask Clarity: From day one, she makes it 100% what she expects in her class. Easiness: If you put in the effort to read, her class is an easy A for sure. Etc: she's a very personable professor, and she's always up for discussion.

Overall, she was an ok professor. DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT take her if you arent willing to read on your own and attend every single class. She is tough and doesn't seem to care about her students grades. However, she makes class fun and its always interesting. If you take her be prepared to read read read.

I would not take her again if I can help it. She is extremely disorganized, inconsiderate, and only teaches you the part of the chapter that she agrees with. So, studying with your book can get you into trouble when she disagrees with a point. She won't e-mail when she cancels class. She won't e-mail you for weeks if you e-mail her. I'm frustrated.

Good teacher, class is straightforward.  If you read the book, or even write down the key words, you can pass the quizzes.  Test and exams are just big quizzes really.  She talks about the lessons and gives real live examples.  She eliminates a couple of the lowest quiz scores.  Give effort, and you'll be fine.

She is a very fun and enthusiastic professor that likes to incorporate good examples of the concepts in class. Although, really most of the class is learned straight from the textbook. The weekly quizzes are pretty simple if you do read the chapter and took notes. It's ok to get some low grades on them. The tests are pretty confusing and tough too.

I did not learn a damn thing. Just about everyone fails the final. Doesn't teach. Half the time she talks about herself for 45 minutes and then skims over 45 slides of notes that are in a boring format. As a result, prepare to learn not a thing. Avoid.

Professor Williams is a decent professor. For pros, she was usually on time, was good at presenting the material, and graded very fairly. For cons, attendance is mandatory, quizzes are a bit hard, there is a project that is peer graded, and she is very loud. She's pretty funny, but if you don't want a professor who tells stories, then watch out.

She doesn't teach very much. Usually, she'll skim through an outdated PP that is just the section titles of the book in bullet form and then tell a bunch of crazy, pointless stories from when she was a social worker. She seems nice and fun until she causes you to have a nervous breakdown and forces you to drop out of the class.

I took diversity with her this past semester but I have had her before and as long as she sees you are putting in a good effort, you will do fine. You will need to do a project based on someone in your class that doesn't have much in common with you so you can better understand they're culture and lifestyle. There is also weekly assignents

I enjoyed this class very much. She assigns homework every class but if you don't want to do it you can take a quiz in class. She gives you many opportunities to raise your grade and its usually something fun like making a video or something. I definitely recommend taking this class

This was the hardest class I have ever taken. First off the text book is of poor quality the way it is laid out it is not easy to follow and hard to study. Secondly I honestly learned nothing about Psychology that is useful. (FYI)The final is the hardest most confusing final ever. I will warn any one that it is 100 questions fill in the blank.
Teacher's projects really didn't convey any helpful understanding of the subject. Becomes biased toward students. Midterm and Final were unnecessarily hard.

Worst prof EVER ! She is extremely biased, VERY judgmental, and the personal journals you complete for extra credit don't stay personal to say the least.... she talked about my journal to other classes , come on ?!?! And she does not teach you anything, I didn't learn a damn thing about psychology, very disappointing class.
Ridiculous!

the previous comment is 100% correct. She picked obvious favorites from day one and gave them better grades on the research paper, even if they were dumb as dirt. She told us on the first day not to be offended if she made jokes about child ****ation. WTF. Her midterm and final are unnecessarily hard. I did not learn a thing about psychology.

If you want to attend a three ring circus twice a week then this class is for you. Prof is very unorganized all she does is yell about students talking and we never got anywhere in class. very unfair grading, very biased to certain students in class. I sat near the front and try to interact but all she cares about is the class clown. terrible prof
Very knowledgeable, class was entertaining.
Very nice woman with a lot of energy about the subject.  As long as you show good effort and ask a few questions, you should be fine.  Do the extra credit!

I loved her class.  She is very helpful and gives lots of opportunities for extra credit.  She is one of the best teachers I have ever had.  It was the class I looked forward to everyday.  if you listen it is easy to learn the subject as she relates it to everyday experiences.  Great teacher.

I loved the class, she didnt teach alot, she made us read the book. I didnt read just skim through and look at the important stuff. She gives alot of extra credit (13 points on final grade, but must work for it) No quiz or test only midterm and final (KINDA HARD)TAKE HER CLASS EASY A

Overall the class is easy. Ready the book is very important in this class. she like to talk about her family which is pretty entertaining. Make sure you take your time on the homework because that is basically your study guide for the midterm and final. she gives lots of extra credit making it easy to pass.  -MOARalex

Worst teacher I have had in my 2 years at SPSU.  She grades very unfairly.  She has screwed me out of at least 5 points on my final grade in the class.  I plan on getting a C when I should have had a B.  I haven't learned a single thing.  I have had to teach myself everything.  On the other hand, her class is fun.  She just can't teach. STAY AWAY!!

She has poor organizational skills, poor communication, and is vague about what she expects. The papers are graded unfairly. She talks about her family a lot and is entertaining. She also gives a lot of extra credit, but learning is minimal.

Really nice if you are nice to her. don't curse in her class, she hates that. attendence is taken everyday. homework assignments from book are everyday. only two test- midterm and final- both very hard. but i didn't study for my midterm and got a 78, studied for the final and past the class with an A. she gives lots of extra credit.

Cool professor, very nosy... which is understandable considering her profession.  Always talks about her family and how brilliant they are, all in all she's a cool lady.  The class is not hard just go over the assigned reading and you'll be ok.  Make sure you do the extra credit, I didn't and missed out on 13 points added to my final grade!
loved her class

Main things about the class, only two test, mid-term and final. The mid-term is hard and the final is even harder. Don't sweat too much because she adds points like crazy (Curves). She is incredibly vague about what she wants for assignments, bad. There is a research paper around 6 pages that is relatively easy. You also have a group presentation.

She has another job and is never available to help u out. The only tests were the Mid-term and final, and they were rediculously hard, study but don't sweat it a lot she will curve the grades in the end. She gives a lot of class assignments but she also gives a lot of extra credit. She was ok but not my favorite teacher by any means.

This class was a waste of time because that she never had an organized agenda and assignments were neither thoroughly described neither in words nor were they in print. The two tests in there, the midterm and final, are impossible to completely study for due to the fact that she asks questions pertaining to what are and are not felonies...

I think that she is the worst teacher i have ever had. The projects are irrelevent to the class, assignments are vague, and she does not make herself available for any outside help. Avoid her class if at all possible.
Just go to class and take notes,  do all the homeworks and class work.  the extra credit raises your final grade by 10 points,  class is easy

Class was not the difficult and she was not vague at all.  The assignments are meant for you to make them your own.  Has a lot of extra credit and the group project is what saves your grade.  The mid-term is impossible and the final is harder. I got an A.

Sylabus is to be followed (for the most part).  Assignments tend to change midway through but she is reasonable for those who have already done the assigments.  Write down exactly what she assigns for proof of what she assigns to do well in this class.  Tests are on the difficult but grading is more than fair.

She is very unorganized and does not explain class assignments very well.  She does not give very interesting lectures and her tests are rediculous.  I didnt like her angel of teaching at all and I think she come up with a more organized/structured way of teaching.like assinment sheets with duedates

Two tests, midterm and final.  The projects were all due at once.  Horribly written test questions, and almost no explanation on assignments.  Seems to know what she's talking about, but not how to explain it.  Be prepared to do a lot of reading, and understand it.  Mandatory Attendance

This professor is nice but does not explain the assignments at all...there is a lot of reading and basically you have to be able to learn from the book to pass this class. Also there are two projects one that is a group one and one that is not. They are fairly easy and her grading is fair.
